t: To the chief Musician, A Psalm for the sons of Korah.
Lord,*sp thou hast been favourable unto thy land: thou hast brought back the captivity of Jacob.
Thou*p hast forgiven the iniquity of thy people, thou hast covered all their sin. Selah.
Thou*p hast taken away all thy wrath: thou hast turned thyself from the fierceness of thine anger.
Turn*p us, O God of our salvation, and cause thine anger toward us to cease.
Wilt*p thou be angry with us for ever? wilt thou draw out thine anger to all generations?
Wilt*p thou not revive us again: that thy people may rejoice in thee?
Shew*p us thy mercy, O Lord,*s and grant us thy salvation.
I*p will hear what God the Lord*s will speak: for he will speak peace unto his people, and to his saints: but let them not turn again to folly.
Surely*p his salvation is nigh them that fear him; that glory may dwell in our land.
Mercy*p and truth are met together; righteousness and peace have kissed each other.
Truth*p shall spring out of the earth; and righteousness shall look down from heaven.
Yea,*p the Lord*s shall give that which is good; and our land shall yield her increase.
Righteousness*p shall go before him; and shall set us in the way of his steps.
